fields.description: Read metrics single value in the duration of required metrics

fields.name: readMetricsValues
fields.description: Read time-series values in the duration of required metrics

fields.description: Read entity list of required metrics and parent entity type.

Read value in the given time duration, usually as a linear.
labels: the labels you need to query.

fields.name: readHeatMap
fields.description: Heatmap is bucket based value statistic result.

fields.name: readSampledRecords
fields.description:
Read the sampled records
TopNCondition#scope is not required.

fields.name: getMultipleLinearIntValues
fields.description:
Query the type of metrics including multiple values, and format them as multiple linears.
The seq of these multiple lines base on the calculation func in OAL
Such as, should us this to query the result of func percentile(50,75,90,95,99) in OAL,
then five lines will be responsed, p50 is the first element of return value.

fields.name: getProfileTaskSegmentList

fields.name: getProfiledSegment

fields.name: getProfileAnalyze
fields.description: analyze profiled segment, start and end time use timestamp(millisecond)

fields.name: getAllTemplates
fields.description:
Read all configuration templates for dashboard and topology pages.
Dashboard could have multiple options and partial actived.
Topology templates should be unique for every typs, if more than one exists, UI should choose one only.

includingDisabled represents whether includes the disabled templates in the query result. Default value is false.
Mostly, should not include, but in the management page, should consider support this.

types.description: The endpoint topology

fields.name: label
fields.description: Could be null if no label assigned in the query condition

fields.name: values
fields.description: Values of this label value.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Literal string name for visualization

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID represents the owner of this entity.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Usually an integer value as this is metrics.

fields.name: refId
fields.description:
Have value, Only if the record has related trace id.
UI should show this as an attached value.

fields.name: values
fields.description:
Each element of values matches the time point of the query duration.
The element in the IntValues represents the value of the same index bucket

fields.name: buckets
fields.description: Bucket describes the ranges of #values represent.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description:
Each element in nodes represents a point in Thermodynamic Diagram
And the element includes three values:
1) Time Bucket based on query duration
2) Response time index.
Response time = [responseTimeStep * index, responseTimeStep * (index+1))
The last element: [Response Time * index, MAX)
3) The number of calls in this response time duration.

Example:
[ [0, 0, 10], [0, 1, 43], ...]
These ^^^ two represent the left bottom element, and another element above it.

This is the value, the caller must understand the Unit.
Such as:
1. If ask for cpm metric, the unit and result should be count.
2. If ask for response time (p99 or avg), the unit should be millisecond.

types.name: Duration
types.description:
The Duration defines the start and end time for each query operation.
Fields: `start` and `end`
represents the time span. And each of them matches the step.
ref https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt
The time formats are
`SECOND` step: yyyy-MM-dd HHmmss
`MINUTE` step: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm
`HOUR` step: yyyy-MM-dd HH
`DAY` step: yyyy-MM-dd
`MONTH` step: yyyy-MM
Field: `step`
represents the accurate time point.
e.g.
if step==HOUR , start=2017-11-08 09, end=2017-11-08 19
then
metrics from the following time points expected
2017-11-08 9:00 -> 2017-11-08 19:00
there are 11 time points (hours) in the time span.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description:
Metrics name, which should be defined in OAL script
Such as:
Endpoint_avg = from(Endpoint.latency).avg()
Then, `Endpoint_avg`

inputFields.name: entity
inputFields.description: Follow entity definition description.

inputFields.name: scope
inputFields.description:
1. scope=All, no name is required.
2. scope=Service, ServiceInstance and Endpoint, set neccessary serviceName/serviceInstanceName/endpointName
3. Scope=ServiceRelation, ServiceInstanceRelation and EndpointRelation
serviceName/serviceInstanceName/endpointName is/are the source(s)
destServiceName/destServiceInstanceName/destEndpointName is/are destination(s)
set necessary names of sources and destinations.

inputFields.name: normal
inputFields.description:
Normal service is the service having installed agent or metrics reported directly.
Unnormal service is conjectural service, usually detected by the agent.

inputFields.name: destNormal
inputFields.description:
Normal service is the service having installed agent or metrics reported directly.
Unnormal service is conjectural service, usually detected by the agent.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Metrics name

inputFields.name: parentService
inputFields.description: Could be null if query the global top N.

inputFields.name: normal
inputFields.description:
Normal service is the service having installed agent or metrics reported directly.
Unnormal service is conjectural service, usually detected by the agent.

inputFields.name: scope
inputFields.description:
Indicate the metrics entity scope.
This is required in sortMetrics query.
Only accept scope = Service/ServiceInstance/Endpoint, ignore others due to those are pointless.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description:
Metric name, which should be defined in OAL script
Such as:
Endpoint_avg = from(Endpoint.latency).avg()
Then, `Endpoint_avg`

inputFields.name: ids
inputFields.description:
Id in this metric type.
In the above case, the id should be endpoint id.

Top N record query is different with aggregation Query.
Both of query results are top N, but aggregation topN query needs to do aggregation at query stage,
the top N record query is just do order and get the list.
Legacy metrics query protocol
Replaced by the metrics-v2 in the future
Top N query is based on latency order by given service and metric name.

inputFields.name: order
inputFields.description: Top N order, ASC or DES.

types.name: MetricsType
types.description:
Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
distributed with this work for additional information
regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the

WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
limitations under the License.
Metrics v2 query protocol is an alternative metrics query(s) of original v1,
defined in the metric.graphql, top-n-records.graphqls, and aggregation.graphqls.
By leveraging the new ID rule(no register) in the v8, we could query metrics based on name(s) directly.
Metrics type is a new concept since v8.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Can't find the metrics type definition.

enumValues.name: REGULAR_VALUE
enumValues.description: Regular value type is suitable for readMetricsValue, readMetricsValues and sortMetrics

enumValues.name: LABELED_VALUE
enumValues.description:
Metrics value includes multiple labels, is suitable for readLabeledMetricsValues
Label should be assigned before the query happens, such as at the setting stage

enumValues.name: HEATMAP
enumValues.description: Heatmap value suitable for readHeatMap

enumValues.name: SAMPLED_RECORD
enumValues.description: Top metrics is for readSampledRecords only.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema IDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar IDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface IDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field IDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.
